page.title: 01Whiteadder Reservoir
page.content: Remote & beautiful. Heavy snow in winter. Land rises from Whiteadder Resr., associated waters and wetlands through cultivated farmland and fields, some deciduous & coniferous trees, to the heather & moorland which grace the landscape from Spartleton (highest Point) to Bothwwell Hill. The land them falls away to Bothwell Water. The reservoir was built in 1969 holds 1,750 million gallons of water, pumps 4.8 million/day, stocked with brown trout. Income - from sheep (3,000 breeding ewes), cattle (50) and tourism (grouse shooting). Crops are fro winter feeding. Land also used as "Summer Pasture". Population 18-mostly incomers, 6 married couples, 6 children. Grown-up children left the area. Jobs - farm manager, shepherds, water worker, male nurses, officer for elderly. (Nurses/Officer
